messages.message: There is also another PR that I merged (before Yash’s). Folks have to rebase, then recompile and restart all core services for either PR to take effect.
ppy compile core && ppy restart core

i was able to use the prebuilt images for `core-platform-service`, `job-service`, and `file-service`

but i got this error when trying to get the prebuilt image for `license-service`, and running `ppy compile license-service --as-docker` produces the same error

```/Users/serenawang/instabase/core-services/license-service/../../shared-utils/build-utils/shared/build-go-service.mk:16: Running target build-docker-no-host-build
docker buildx build --builder container --load \
	--build-arg BASE_GO_IMAGE_TAG=23.09.25.02.33.48 \
	--build-arg HOST_USER_ID="501" \
	--build-arg HOST_GROUP_ID="20" \
	--build-arg HOST_KERNEL="Darwin" \
	-f Dockerfile.build -t instabase/license-service-build .
ERROR: no builder "container" found```
cc @Cody Boggs since it seems you recently changed the docker build commands https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/49665

Hey sorry, yea there’s an edge I didn’t realize when it’s a local workstation build 
I’ll share the temp local fix in a sec when I get back to my desk
it’s strange that i only got this error for `license-service` and not the other `core` services though? :thinking_face:

Fix is here
https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C039JKRCE2H/p1700582008081819?thread_ts=1700513248.038559&cid=C039JKRCE2H

As noted, only do this locally for now :sweat_smile:
I have a refactor that is almost ready for a PR, but needs to be tested and run through a sandbox deploy first

Yea, that local fix should do the trick @Serena
Sorry for the back and forth
The layered inclusion of Makefiles is problematic, so it’s easy to get lost in the sauce. :slightly_smiling_face:
